        public void addTimeCreditBalance(int minutes)
        This method adds time to the user credit balance. The duration to add is expressed in minutes.
        Parameters:
        minutes - correspond to minutes

      • addTimeCreditBalance

        public void addTimeCreditBalance(int minutes,
                                 int seconds)
        This method adds time to the user time credit balance. The duration to add is expressed in minutes and in seconds.
        Parameters:
        minutes - correspond to minutes
        seconds - correspond to seconds

      • addTimeCreditBalance

        public void addTimeCreditBalance(int hours,
                                 int minutes,
                                 int seconds)
        This method adds time to the user credit balance. The duration to add is expressed in hours, in minutes and in seconds.
        Parameters:
        hours - correspond to hours
        minutes - correspond to minutes
        seconds - correspond to seconds

      • getCard

        public Card getCard()

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(Card card)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method is called when a user subscribes to a subscription program. The type of subscription is handle by the type of card the user subscribed to. The Card object calls this method when being created at the user's name.
        Parameters:
        card - Should be a card
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - When a user tries to subscribe to a wrong card (a card that belongs to another user)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ride> getListOfRides()

      • isOnRide

        public boolean isOnRide()
        This private method returns true if the user is currently on a ride, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • newRide

        public void newRide(Station station)
             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        This method is used to generate a new Ride object stored in listOfRides attribute.

        Use case:
        The user approaches a station and decides to take a bike for a ride. The user has no preference on the type of bicycle. So the station "decides" for him to choose a bicycle and take it off from the right parking slot, or returns an error if no bike is available.
        Parameters:
        station - Should be a Station object
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Throws RuntimeException when a user tries to start a new ride without finishing his current ride.

      • newRide

        public void newRide(Station station,
                    java.lang.String bicycleType)
             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        This method is used to generate a new Ride object stored in listOfRides attribute.

        Use case:
        The user approaches a station and decides to take a bike for a ride. The user has preference on the type bicycle. So the station delivers the right bicycle if possible and return an error otherwise.
        Parameters:
        station - Should be a Station object
        bicycleType - A String corresponding to the type of bicycle wanted
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Throws RuntimeException when a user tries to start a new ride without finishing his current ride.

      • getCurrentRide

        public Ride getCurrentRide()
        This method returns the current (not finished) ride of a user if it exists.
        Returns:
        Ride Ride object or null if not current ride

      • endCurrentRide

        public void endCurrentRide(Station station)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method should be used when a user want to end his current Ride at a specified station.
        Parameters:
        station - The station where to end the ride
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Occurs when the station is full or when there is no parking slot available

      • planRide

        public void planRide(Localization source,
                     Localization destination)
        This method should be used when a user want to plan a future ride. A new object Travel associated to the user is created. The user then has the possibility to find automatically a start station and an end station, and to calculate the duration and cost of this ride. By default, the start station and end station are chosen so as to minimize the walking time. The type of bicycle is indifferent.
        Parameters:
        source - the initial position of the user
        destination - the destination of the user

      • planRide

        public void planRide(Localization source,
                     Localization destination,
                     PathStrategy pathStrategy)
        This method should be used when a user want to plan a future ride. A new object Travel associated to the user is created. The user then has the possibility to find automatically a start station and an end station according to the strategy specified by the user, and to calculate the duration and cost of this ride. The type of bicycle is indifferent.
        Parameters:
        source - the initial position of the user
        destination - the destination of the user
        pathStrategy - the PathStrategy employed to chose the start and end stations

      • planRide

        public void planRide(Localization source,
                     Localization destination,
                     java.lang.String bicycleType,
                     PathStrategy pathStrategy)
        This method should be used when a user want to plan a future ride. A new object Travel associated to the user is created. The user then has the possibility to find automatically a start station and an end station according to the strategy specified by the user, and to calculate the duration and cost of this ride. The user should specify the desired type of bicycle.
        Parameters:
        source - the initial position of the user
        destination - the destination of the user
        bicycleType - the desired type of bicycle
        pathStrategy - the PathStrategy employed to chose the start and end stations

      • planRide

        public void planRide(Localization source,
                     Localization destination,
                     java.lang.String bicycleType)
        This method should be used when a user want to plan a future ride. A new object Travel associated to the user is created. The user then has the possibility to find automatically a start station and an end station, and to calculate the duration and cost of this ride. By default, the start station and end station are chosen so as to minimize the walking time. The user should specify the desired type of bicycle.
        Parameters:
        source - the initial position of the user
        destination - the destination of the user
        bicycleType - the desired type of bicycle
